div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1008 Kupurub, suburb of Ochakov, Niko- (576) laev oblast, Ukraine, 1890-1900? Burial: 400-350 B.C. ? Contents: 16+ AE Olbia: aes grave (12 as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 4-not 3, as in Noe) Disposition: Leningrad 4 (merged with main collection) Book 44, Record of Acquisitions (manuscript, Numismatic Division, Hermitage) Hess Nov. 28, 1912, 57-68 Possibly more than one hoard
